title: Best CPU cooler for AMD Ryzen 7 7800X3D - noise reduction, budget, and more
text: AMD has just added another impressive piece of hardware to their lineup; the Ryzen 7 7800 X3D. This CPU is currently one of the best gaming processors on the market, but this comes at a price – cooling. It has a 120W TDP, and according to the tests, it can get pretty hot. Therefore. to keep those temperatures down and maintain optimal performance you’ll need to find a compatible CPU cooler. In this article, we discuss the best CPU cooler for AMD Ryzen 7 7800 X3D; covering a range of different options. If you want to learn more about this product, check out some of our other coverage. Including our article on the best motherboards and the best GPUs for Ryzen 7 7800 X3D.  We consider coolers that offer a balance between effective heat dissipation, noise levels, and longevity. Preference is given to coolers with proven track records of handling CPUs with similar or higher TDPs, ensuring they can comfortably manage the thermal demands of the Ryzen 7 7800X3D. We also take into account user reviews and industry benchmarks to gauge real-world performance and reliability. Coolers with innovative features like improved fan design, enhanced heat pipe technology, or superior liquid cooling capabilities are favored.   The ARCTIC Liquid Freezer II 360 A-RGB distinguishes itself in the cooling market, particularly for users optimizing the performance of a Ryzen 7 7800X3D. Featuring three P12 120mm A-RGB fans with a maximum speed of 1,800 RPM, this cooler extends beyond basic cooling functionalities. Its blend of design and performance makes it a prime choice for those seeking an effective cooling solution that doesn’t compromise on aesthetics. This cooler’s standout attribute is its superior cooling performance, essential for keeping temperatures low under intense gaming sessions or demanding computational tasks. It’s especially suitable for those looking to overclock their 7800X3D, offering significant thermal capacity. The ARCTIC Liquid Freezer II 360 A-RGB’s innovative pump design and integrated cable management system contribute to a neat and efficient build, enhancing both the functionality and visual appeal of the setup.   For enthusiasts who prefer air cooling, the Cooler Master MasterAir MA824 Stealth stands as a formidable option, particularly for its remarkably quiet operation. Often, air coolers can be noisy, especially under load, but this model challenges that norm, delivering a cooling solution that rivals even the acclaimed quietness of Noctua coolers. Its sophisticated design caters to users who value both aesthetics and function, making it an excellent match for the Ryzen 7 7800X3D processor. What sets the Cooler Master MasterAir MA824 Stealth apart is its balance between noise reduction and cooling efficiency. The cooler is equipped with dual Mobius fans that manage to keep the operation noise to a minimal level while still providing top-tier cooling performance.   The Alphacool Eisbaer Pro Aurora 240 stands out as a top-tier 240mm cooler, perfect for high-performance systems like the Ryzen 7 7800X3D. It’s particularly suited for enthusiasts who value thermal efficiency, even though it may be a bit noisy under load. This cooler is not just about excellent cooling; it also brings a stylish aesthetic to your setup, making it a great choice for those seeking effective overclocking support and a sleek design at a reasonable price. While its cooling performance is impressive, the noise level of the fans and potential RAM clearance issues are points to consider, especially for noise-sensitive users or those with taller memory modules. Despite these considerations, the Alphacool Eisbaer Pro Aurora 240’s combination of performance, style, and build quality makes it a compelling option for users willing to manage these aspects.   The Thermalright Peerless Assassin 120 SE shines as an outstanding air cooler, particularly impressive for its budget-friendly price of only $36 USD. Rarely do you find such an effective cooler at this price, making it ideal for budget-conscious builders. This cooler excels in cooling high-TDP CPUs like Alder Lake processors, delivering great value for those wanting top performance on a budget. Key strengths of the Thermalright Peerless Assassin 120 SE include its high cooling efficiency for high-TDP CPUs and remarkably quiet operation, suitable for users who value a tranquil environment. It performs admirably even at lower TDPs, offering efficient cooling without noise or high cost. A consideration, however, is its size. As an air cooler, it takes up considerable space, which could pose challenges in smaller builds or cases with limited room. While typically not an issue for standard cases, it’s a factor for compact setups. Still, for its excellent combination of performance, affordability, and quiet operation, the Thermalright Peerless Assassin 120 SE stands out as a prime choice.   When selecting a cooler for the Ryzen 7 7800X3D, it’s crucial to consider both its TDP rating and heat dissipation efficiency. With a 120W TDP, the Ryzen 7 7800X3D demands a cooling solution that can effectively manage its heat output, especially during intensive gaming or heavy computational tasks. A good cooler not only maintains optimal temperatures but also extends the CPU’s lifespan by preventing overheating. Air coolers and liquid coolers are both viable options, with air coolers typically being more budget-friendly and easier to install, while liquid coolers offer superior cooling efficiency and aesthetic appeal.  The Ryzen 7800X3D is relatively easy to cool. Despite being a high-performance CPU, it has a manageable TDP of around 120 watts, which doesn’t typically exceed 90 watts. This means that it doesn’t generate excessive heat under normal operating conditions, making it compatible with a wide range of cooling solutions, from high-end liquid coolers to more budget-friendly air coolers.  When it comes to selecting the best cooler for your Ryzen 7 7800X3D, it’s important to consider your specific needs and preferences. Whether you opt for the high-end performance and low noise of the ARCTIC Liquid Freezer II 360 A-RGB, the unique design and top-tier air cooling of the Cooler Master MasterAir MA824 Stealth, the striking design and impressive cooling efficiency of the Alphacool Eisbaer Pro Aurora 240, or the budget-friendly yet highly capable Thermalright Peerless Assassin 120 SE, each cooler offers distinct advantages.
